name: places/ChIJIZMoCSz3wokRNB_09wq3BJY
formattedAddress: 233 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 233 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: Hard to believe that this hotel has four stars. As a Marriott Platinum Elite guest I have stayed in many Marriott properties and this one needs work. The furnace in my room never produced enough heat to get the room above 66 degrees my entire stay. The wait staff in the restaurant is more interested in texting on their phones and getting coffee for each other than opening on time and serving their guests. It is in a good location in Harlem…I guess that is why the staff don’t feel like they have to work too hard to operate the hotel for their guests…instead of themselves.

originalText.text:
Seems like a nice hotel.
Rooms are very compact but nice, the bathroom is a bit odd with shower door opening in a way you can only get in with the pocket doors open to the sleeping area.
Overall it's nice and the breakfast was surprisingly good.

originalText.text: I loved this hotel, mostly because of the incredibly hospitable hotel staff, who just made me feel very welcomed and at home. The king room and bed were very comfortable, even relatively quiet though right above 125th St. Note that the bathroom does not have walls, so it's a better space for one person or two who are quite intimate. There was a $25/day fee and $25 daily vouchers for food, which don't seem to cover tax or mandatory gratuity, which might irk some. The restaurant menu and service did not delight me as much as the front desk staff and room, but it's fine. The cocktail was great. Overall a very fun, friendly, comfortable experience.

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Renaissance New York Harlem Hotel, and it was truly an exceptional experience.

First and foremost, the staff deserves a special mention. They were incredibly welcoming, attentive, and went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable. Their warm hospitality added a personal touch that made my stay memorable.

The decor of the hotel is simply wonderful, with a modern yet inviting ambiance that immediately puts you at ease. The attention to detail in the design is evident, and it creates a unique atmosphere.

The rooms are bright and spacious, providing a comfortable retreat after a day of exploring the city. The cleanliness of the bathroom was impeccable, and it's clear that the hotel takes hygiene seriously.

The only minor drawback was the water pressure in the shower, which wasn't as high as I'm used to. However, this was a small inconvenience compared to the overall positive experience.

While staying at the hotel, I had the pleasure of dining at the Victoria restaurant, where I tried the shrimp and grits. It was a culinary delight! The flavors were exquisite, and I highly recommend trying this dish during your stay.

In summary, the Renaissance New York Harlem Hotel offers a fantastic stay with its amazing staff, beautiful decor, and comfortable rooms. Don't miss the opportunity to dine at Victoria for a delicious culinary experience. This hotel is a true gem in the heart of Harlem, and I can't wait to return for another visit!

originalText.text:
Gotta say I was pretty surprised with the hotel when I got to the lobby. Feels very high end. Rooms are small but cozy and sleek. Great views.

But what really made the experience five stars was the customer service at check in. Neesha made what was a pretty lame day into a memorable one. Incredibly friendly and efficient work! Had some questions about CC auth that she cleared up super well. Top quality staff pick right there. That girl deserves a raise!
